what do you guys think that scene meant>
summary: arya gave sansa a dagger before forcing her down to the crypts and told her “stick them with the pointy end.” the last time we...
body: arya gave sansa a dagger before forcing her down to the crypts and told her “stick them with the pointy end.” the last time we watched a stark give another stark a weapon was when bran gave arya the valyrian dagger. the one that ended the night king. maybe this means sansa will use the dagger arya gave to her in 8x03 in the future?

summary:
“This is insane.” Arya says staring at Jojen. Her brother’s best friend had obviously gone mad. 
“It’s not. You know its...
caption:
“This is insane.” Arya says staring at Jojen. Her brother’s best friend had obviously gone mad.
“It’s not. You know its not…want a piece?” Jojen says, his mouth half full of strawberry and waffle and whipped cream.
“You are saying that Bran is not actually in a coma, but is being controlled by some mutated bird.”
“The three eyed raven.”
“You’re mad.”
“And your still sitting here. Bran told me what you could do, you know? How you talk to ghosts.”
Arya feels her skin prickle at that and tells herself that she is being stupid. This whole thing is stupid. She and Bran had played at being different as children. Bran knew too much because he could see the past and the future. Arya could make friends with anyone living or dead. It had only been a game, a way to comfort herself when she felt isolated in her own home. She knows. The therapist Mother and Father had sent them to was very clear on this.
“Bran was wrong and ghosts aren’t even real.”
Jojen stares at her thoughtfully as he chews his waffle. He looks much like he did when Howland Reed had first shown up with his children. His eyes are the same spring green color they always have been. That stupid unnerving green color that made one feel as if he could see right through you.
“Bran needs our help…so does Meera.”
Arya grimaces at Meera’s name. The two had been friends, though it became a bit awkward when it became clear that Meera and Bran were going to be a…thing. The night they had found Bran in the forest they had been so happy even if he was in a coma, but the news was dimmed when it was noticed that Meera was missing.
“The doctors are helping Bran and the police will find Meera.” Arya tries to make her voice as reassuring as possible. Can she leave now? How cruel is it to leave the best friend of your brother sitting in a Waffle House?
“The doctors cannot help Bran, the issue is not the coma. The issue is the three eyed raven.”
“Okay. I was willing to hear you out Jojen, but this is getting a bit much. I’m going to go.”
“Wait!,’ he cries grabbing her hand, ‘I can prove it.”
He lets go of her and reaches for his backpack. She should run for the door now, but stupid girl that she is she grimaces at her hand where some strawberry juice got on it and tries to ignore the fact that Jojen is mumbling to his backpack.  Arya is about to go with her basic instincts and flee when he turns back to her. In his hands is a raven. A normal looking raven that Jojen Reed apparently caught. She should call someone, maybe the police or Howland or someone.
“Go on, Bran, tell her.”
Arya looks from the bird to Jojen to the bird. Oh fuck this. This is not funny, not even a little bit. Her little brother is lying in a hospital bed and Jojen Reed has decided to play pretend with wildlife.
Arya opens her mouth to start yelling when she is cut off.
“Listen to him, Arya, i know its mad but its true.”
Bran’s voice is coming from the raven as it hops towards her.
“Bran?”
“I need your help, Arya.”
Arya looks from the bird to Jojen, eyes wide. Jojen seems unperturbed as he goes back to his waffles. The world has gone mad and she is stuck with Jojen Reed in a Waffle House at the edge of town.
Cryptid AU - Arya and Jojen go to save Bran and Meera from the Three Eyed Raven, love and high-jinks ensue  For the love @princessaryathe who requested Arya x Jojen. Hope you liked it!

blog.name: adecila
blog.title: Project Dark!Alice - This is an anti GoT blog now
blog.description: [on holiday]I Stand With Daenerys Targaryen | Jonerys, Tom Hiddleston, GoT...basically a multifandom blog | "aliciutza" on A03 - writer (of that demon!Jon fic, a bunch of drabbles and some crackfics), but mostly a professional commenter on Jonerys fics. "Very busy lawyer lady." I drink and I read fics, that's what I do... besides knowing secrets. If I'd have to eat one food till the end of my days it would be sarmale. tumblr says I'm Ravenclaw and a Tully. But I'm probably somewhere between Daenerys Targaryen and Cersei Lannister. I guess I make moodboards now and beta for a bunch of people. Yes, I love sleep but I rarely get any. No, I wouldn't trade it for the whole world.

tags: it’s not that there wasn’t much potential
but that would also required a very different story telling
summary: Can you people exactly tell me why Bran was useless. Like, what more could he have done, grab a sword and start fighting?...
body:
Can you people exactly tell me why Bran was useless. Like, what more could he have done, grab a sword and start fighting? Especially considering D&D ignoring everything “magical” except for pretty cgi. 

He warned the rest about the NK, told them as much info he knew about the WW and even willingly put himself in danger, so the others had a chance to win. What more could he have done to be consider useful by your standards.

blog.name: sassenachscreencaps
blog.title: Screencaps & More!
blog.description: Here I post screencaps to some of my favorite shows & movies, edits I make, fanfiction I write, and chapter-by-chapter book reviews! [ PERSONAL BLOG: awakened-df ]

summary: Game of Thrones 8x03 “The Long Night”: My realizations/weird epiphanies I have a sort-of-theory that the Night King was a...
body:
Game of Thrones 8x03 “The Long Night”: My realizations/weird epiphanies

I have a sort-of-theory that the Night King was a coward. I said sort of! It’s just that scene where Jon was running towards him and instead of fighting him, he just raises the dead and walks away. I know that’s one of his “signature moves” that’s creepy and badass but like … why not fight? Kill him (not that I want to see Jon die, but from the NKs point of view) and that’s one less person to worry about, one less obstacle. My guess is he knew about Longclaw from the battle at Hardhome and since valyrian steel can kill him … idk that’s all I got.

Probably the biggest epiphany for me though, had to do with Arya, Bran, Theon, the NK, and yet another piece of valyrian steel: the dagger. We know that was the dagger that was originally meant to kill Bran and so it is pretty cool that it ends up saving his life, as most people already realize. But I was thinking … why did Theon have to die if the NK was going to be killed? (I know some Theon fans really don’t like that.) He gave up his life just so the NK could die not that long after?! Well, sure it has something to do with character arcs and all that. But the way I see it is BRAN KNEW. He gave that valyrian steel dagger to Arya (while in the exact same spot under the weirwood tree, might I add) because he knew what it would be used for. For that same reason, he knew Theon had to leave. If he saw Arya coming he might have drawn the NKs attention to her sooner and then they’d all be dead.

This might seem really strange and “out there” but it’s just my opinion. It could change, of course, but that’s what I think right now and I don’t mind if you respectfully disagree.

reblog.comment:
Game of Thrones 8x03 “The Long Night”: My realizations/weird epiphanies

I have a sort-of-theory that the Night King was a coward. I said sort of! It’s just that scene where Jon was running towards him and instead of fighting him, he just raises the dead and walks away. I know that’s one of his “signature moves” that’s creepy and badass but like … why not fight? Kill him (not that I want to see Jon die, but from the NKs point of view) and that’s one less person to worry about, one less obstacle. My guess is he knew about Longclaw from the battle at Hardhome and since valyrian steel can kill him … idk that’s all I got.

Probably the biggest epiphany for me though, had to do with Arya, Bran, Theon, the NK, and yet another piece of valyrian steel: the dagger. We know that was the dagger that was originally meant to kill Bran and so it is pretty cool that it ends up saving his life, as most people already realize. But I was thinking … why did Theon have to die if the NK was going to be killed? (I know some Theon fans really don’t like that.) He gave up his life just so the NK could die not that long after?! Well, sure it has something to do with character arcs and all that. But the way I see it is BRAN KNEW. He gave that valyrian steel dagger to Arya (while in the exact same spot under the weirwood tree, might I add) because he knew what it would be used for. For that same reason, he knew Theon had to leave. If he saw Arya coming he might have drawn the NKs attention to her sooner and then they’d all be dead.

This might seem really strange and “out there” but it’s just my opinion. It could change, of course, but that’s what I think right now and I don’t mind if you respectfully disagree.

blog.name: aryajonstargaryen
blog.description:
She refused to be a Lady. For she was Destined to be a Queen 👑

For she was destined to be a Queen 👑

summary: People really can’t take a girl could be the ultimate savior huh? All because she’s not the one they expected to do the job....
body:
People really can’t take a girl could be the ultimate savior huh? All because she’s not the one they expected to do the job.

This girl who was present when her father was sentenced to death; who wished she could have saved him but was too small, too young and too weak to save him and all she could do was watch as her life fell apart all because of one sadistic bastard.

This girl who was once again dealt fate’s cruel hand; who almost had her family, her home back only for her to witness not only their loss but the brutality that was unleashed even upon their remains, this time at the hands of a whole lot of sadistic bastards.

The girl who couldn’t even fucking cry because she had so much pain that she froze up.

People are seriously begrudging the most amazing thing that could have happened to her. The only thing she had wanted to do all along, be there for her family, protect them.

Arya Stark isn’t a MVP because she saved the TER, she wasn’t destined for greatness because she was seeking immortal glory; she’s a MVP because she could finally accomplish the most important goal she ever had, of protecting her family.

The people who think she’s only a cold blooded mean killing revenge machine have never understood her nor her motivations and so they’ll never even understand why it was important that she got to do this - that she finally could be there for her family. And this time she was not gonna let another sadistic bastard succeed in hurting someone she loves.

This wasn’t Arya being a Mary Sue, this was Arya finally being empowered enough to stand up to the god of death and tell him that he can’t hurt her again. She couldn’t protect her father or her mother or her big brother or even his direwolf, but she wasn’t about to fail again, fail her little brother.

Death is inevitable and would of course ultimately win, but not like this and definitely not today.

blog.description: Heya, I'm Ioanna! | Greek from Germany | Art blog @zografia| Too many Fandoms | I love Astrology & Space | INTP-T | Leo♌ | Shipping pretty much everything here btw | Witchblr Blog: @astravtei | Langblr Blog: @aristorias

tags: *blows kiss to the sea* for theon greyjoy my bby
summary: I bet Theon thought him and Bran were the last survivors because the Night King arrived unchallenged and seemingly without any...
body:
I bet Theon thought him and Bran were the last survivors because the Night King arrived unchallenged and seemingly without any harm to himself in the Godswood and nobody came to help them, not even the dragons were to be seen.

So when he ran towards the Night King with his spear, perhaps even fully aware that this would most likely not work out, he probably thought that he was the last person who could at least try to protect Bran now that everyone is gone.

When he was stabbed and saw the Night King walking over to Bran, he probably thought that not only did he fail to beat the Night King, but by doing so he also failed to protect his second home, failed his family once again, and that he had failed his sister Yara as well by dying
